statement: Stress-test Blue narrative for trust failure modes and declare explicit fail states for confusion, overclaim perception, and judgmental tone.
Translate Blue intent into audience journey framing that increases felt clarity and confidence from first exposure through repeat purchase.
Create canonical definitions and review tests for clarity, confidence, and trustworthy guidance to reduce semantic drift across teams.
Define explicit narrative fail-state tests for confusion, overclaim implication, and judgmental framing, mapped to discovery/evaluation/repeat-purchase journey checkpoints.
Create canonical lexical guardrails distinguishing educational nutrition guidance from efficacy/clinical implication language and encode review fail examples.
Define canonical dual-voice taxonomy (persuasive marketing vs neutral educational) with boundary tests, overlap rules, and prohibited crossover examples.
Produce editorial trust lexicon and terminology normalization guide for health-adjacent claims, certainty qualifiers, and authority signaling language.
Map voice-lead rules by context (owned-channel marketing vs publication-grade educational content) and define user-facing transition principles that preserve trust.
Enumerate exploit patterns where informative framing masks overclaims or persuasive framing degrades editorial credibility; define fail-state detection cues.
Publish a versioned claim-boundary lexicon for nutrition messaging with allowed/disallowed term classes, adversarial counterexamples, and explicit fail-on-phrase tests consumable by review gates.

Define a semantic contradiction checker spec: one canonical definition per term (clarity, confidence, trustworthy guidance) plus pass/fail examples showing cross-team misuse and required normalization decisions.
Create canonical lexical guardrail artifact with allowed/disallowed examples and explicit fail tests for overclaim implication, efficacy-adjacent wording, and judgment framing.
Require provenance metadata fields in review/approval artifacts: prompt version, model/version, source input hash, editor log, confidence label, and approval timestamp.
Define canonical dual-voice taxonomy (persuasive marketing vs neutral educational) with boundary tests, overlap rules, and prohibited crossover examples.

Produce editorial trust lexicon and terminology normalization guide for health-adjacent claims, certainty qualifiers, and authority signaling language.
Define publication-grade evidence and attribution language boundaries for educational vs promotional content classes, including required qualifier patterns and disallowed authority signals.
Define claim-level confidence labeling rubric (section and sentence scope) with pass/fail examples and contradiction handling rules.
Enumerate adversarial editorial exploit patterns where neutral educational tone is used to smuggle promotional overreach; provide detection cues and fail states.
Map dual-voice transition rules for external publication pieces versus owned-channel campaigns, including user expectation continuity checkpoints.
Publish an adversarial lexical minimal-pair suite that tests semantic drift between educational and persuasive modes under synonym/paraphrase substitutions with explicit pass/fail criteria.
Define context-window fail tests that reject bounded safe phrases when co-occurring with urgency, fear pressure, or implied therapeutic certainty within the same artifact segment.
Specify canonical superseded-ID citation rules for narrative artifacts so audit and incident review consistently map legacy IDs to active team-scoped IDs.

Define exploit-pattern mutation classes (synonym, clause reordering, qualifier inversion, authority-signal substitution) with required fail invariants and coverage thresholds for White review artifacts.
Publish authority-signal red-flag taxonomy for educational-mode content including prohibited comparative constructs and selective-uncertainty patterns with pass/fail examples.
